description: Fols. 19; 20.3 x 13 cm.; written surface 16-17.5 x 7-9 cm.; 29-34 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi and naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red. A collection containing: 1. ʻAqīlat al-maghānī fī taʻaddud al-ghawānī, a collection of metrical correspondence between the author and his friends. 2. The life of ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAbd al-Jalīl al-Farghānī al-Marghīnānī, A.H. 593 [A.D. 1196/7]. It is entitled al-ʻIqd al-thamīn. 3. Two fragments, one on the classification of knowledge and the other on tradition. MS in fair condition; Arabic binding. Probably from the latter part of XVIIIth century. Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.
